snippet: Iran’s Foreign Ministry said the legislation passed by the House of Representatives on Wednesday would complicate efforts to settle the nuclear standoff diplomatically.
abstract: Iran reacts angrily to harsh legislation on sanctions passed by United States House of Representatives; says that action will further complicate stalled negotiations aimed at resolving protracted dispute over Iranian nuclear energy program.

byline.original: By THOMAS ERDBRINK and RICK GLADSTONE
byline.contributor: Thomas Erdbrink reported from Tehran, and Rick Gladstone from New York.

lead_paragraph: Iran’s Foreign Ministry said the legislation passed by the House of Representatives on Wednesday would complicate efforts to settle the nuclear standoff diplomatically.

headline.main: Iran Assails House Sanctions Bill, Saying It Will Complicate Nuclear Dispute
headline.print_headline: Iran Assails House Sanctions Bill, Saying It Will Complicate Nuclear Dispute
